revised_title: Dorothy Hodgkin: A Tribute and Portrait
tldr: This article discusses the creation of a portrait of Dorothy Hodgkin, a renowned chemist and Nobel Prize laureate, by Bryan Organ. The portrait was funded by a private subscription from Fellows and Foreign Members of the Royal Society, as well as contributions from firms and institutions. The article also mentions a related project involving a portrait of hands by Henry Moore and sketches by Graham Sutherland, who unfortunately passed away before completing his portrait.
